snippet: The measure would require businesses that get substantial city subsidies to pay their workers more than the minimum wage.
abstract: Partnership for New York City drops its support for a measure that would raise the wages of workers whose companies receive city subsidies; move comes minutes after City Council Speaker Christine C Quinn announces that a provision giving the city the flexibility to exempt important projects from the living wage requirement would be dropped.
lead_paragraph: The measure would require businesses that get substantial city subsidies to pay their workers more than the minimum wage.

headline.seo: Business Group Drops Support for N.Y.C. Wage Bill
headline.main: Business Group Drops Support for Wage Bill
headline.print_headline: Business Group Drops Support for Wage Bill
